result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly Jo Weinert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay domestic abuse surcharge of $100

--continue with all recommended psychological treatment
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--complete a Certified Batterers' Intervention Assessment within 60 days and follow through with all recommendations, including, but not limited to Certified Batterers' Intervention program
--anger management, if recommended by any treatment provider
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to submit DNA sample to designee upon demand

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly Jo Weinert

records.addlTxt: with criminal case settlement and elements
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Case called at 3:39pm [mo]
Defendant Kelly Jo Weinert in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Defense waives the previously entered NGI plea; the accepts this waiver
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1 the Court withholds sentence and places Ms. Weinert on Probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:

--continue with all recommended psychological treatment
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--complete a Certified Batterers' Intervention Assessment within 60 days and follow through with all recommendations, including, but not limited to Certified Batterers' Intervention program
--anger management, if recommended by any treatment provider
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to submit DNA sample to designee upon demand
--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay domestic abuse surcharge of $100


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 3:55pm
Extension to file motions is granted

Case called at 9:15am [mo]
Defendant Kelly Jo Weinert in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.

Atty. Huebner indicates that the Defense is moving to amend Ms. Weinert's plea from not guilty to not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. 
--The Court recognizes this plea

The Court and Counsel agree to schedule this case for Trial in December
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
The Court distributes its scheduling order and adds that shall either party have their own evaluation conducted they are to submit the results to the other party no later than 15 days prior to the Trial date. 

After review by each party, The Court signs the prepared Order for Examination under 971.16
recess: 9:32am

NEXT: 1)FSSC on 12/7/15 at 11:00am  2)Jury Trial on 12/10 AND 12/11/15 at 8:30am (allow 2 days)
Copy of letter from the Court to the defendant advising no action will be taken by the court
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 11:16am.
Defendant Kelly Jo Weinert in court.  ADA John  Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $150 cash bond (already posted), with added conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Cassandra Matek
recess 11:19am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/12/15 at 10:00am   (2)  Status Conference on 9/1/15 at 8:30am
